Developer Guide

Development Environment Setup

Prerequisites

  • Python 3.12 or higher

  • uv (Python package manager)

  • Git

Initial Setup

  1. Clone the repository:

Clone Repository
1git clone https://github.com/yourusername/docdiff.git
2cd docdiff

  1. Install dependencies using uv:

Install Dependencies
uv sync

  1. Install the package in development mode:

Install in Development Mode
uv pip install -e .

  1. Verify installation:

Verify Installation
uv run docdiff --version

Project Structure

Project Directory Structure
docdiff/
├── src/
│   └── docdiff/
│       ├── __init__.py
│       ├── cli.py              # CLI implementation (Typer)
│       ├── models.py            # Pydantic data models
│       ├── parsers/
│       │   ├── __init__.py
│       │   ├── base.py         # Abstract parser interface
│       │   ├── myst.py         # MyST parser implementation
│       │   └── rest.py         # reStructuredText parser
│       ├── database.py          # SQLite database management
│       ├── analyzer.py          # Project analysis
│       └── translator.py        # Translation management
├── tests/
│   ├── unit/                   # Unit tests
│   │   ├── test_models.py
│   │   ├── test_parser_myst.py
│   │   ├── test_parser_rest.py
│   │   └── test_database.py
│   ├── integration/             # Integration tests
│   │   └── test_parse_flow.py
│   └── fixtures/               # Test data
├── docs/
│   └── en/                     # English documentation
├── adr/                         # Architecture Decision Records
├── pyproject.toml              # Project configuration
└── CLAUDE.md                   # AI assistant instructions

Testing Strategy

Running Tests

Run all tests:

Run All Tests
uv run pytest

Run with coverage:

Run Tests with Coverage
uv run pytest --cov=docdiff --cov-report=html

Run specific test categories:

Run Specific Test Categories
1# Unit tests only
2uv run pytest tests/unit/
3
4# Integration tests only
5uv run pytest tests/integration/

Test Coverage Goals

  • Overall Coverage: 80% minimum

  • Core Logic: 90% minimum

  • Error Handling: 100% required

Writing Tests

Example unit test:

Unit Test Example
 1import pytest
 2from docdiff.models import DocumentNode, NodeType
 3
 4def test_document_node_creation():
 5    node = DocumentNode(
 6        id="test123",
 7        type=NodeType.SECTION,
 8        content="Test Section",
 9        file_path="test.md",
10        line_number=1
11    )
12    assert node.id == "test123"
13    assert node.type == NodeType.SECTION

Example integration test:

Integration Test Example
 1import pytest
 2from pathlib import Path
 3from docdiff.cli import parse_command
 4
 5def test_parse_sphinx_project(tmp_path):
 6    # Create test project structure
 7    project_dir = tmp_path / "docs"
 8    project_dir.mkdir()
 9    (project_dir / "index.md").write_text("# Test")
10    
11    # Run parse command
12    result = parse_command(str(project_dir))
13    assert result.success
14    assert result.nodes_count > 0

Code Style Guidelines

Python Code Conventions

  1. Type Hints: Always use type hints for function signatures

Type Hints Example
def parse_document(file_path: Path) -> List[DocumentNode]:
    ...

  1. Docstrings: Use Google-style docstrings

Docstring Example
 1def extract_references(nodes: List[DocumentNode]) -> List[Reference]:
 2    """Extract cross-references from document nodes.
 3    
 4    Args:
 5        nodes: List of document nodes to process
 6        
 7    Returns:
 8        List of extracted references
 9        
10    Raises:
11        ParseError: If reference syntax is invalid
12    """

  1. Comments: Write comments in English

Comment Example
1# Calculate content hash for change detection
2content_hash = hashlib.sha256(content.encode()).hexdigest()

Data Validation

Always use Pydantic models for data validation:

Pydantic Validation Example
 1from pydantic import BaseModel, validator
 2
 3class TranslationUnit(BaseModel):
 4    source_content: str
 5    target_lang: str
 6    
 7    @validator('target_lang')
 8    def validate_language_code(cls, v):
 9        if len(v) != 2:
10            raise ValueError('Language code must be 2 characters')
11        return v.lower()

Implementation Phases

Phase 1: MVP (2 weeks)

Core functionality to be implemented:

  1. Project Structure Setup

    • Initialize repository structure

    • Configure pyproject.toml

    • Set up development environment

  2. Pydantic Models

    • DocumentNode

    • TranslationUnit

    • NodeType enumeration

  3. SQLite Database Management

    • Schema creation

    • CRUD operations

    • Migration support

  4. Basic Parser Implementation

    • MyST parser using myst-parser

    • reStructuredText parser using docutils

    • Common interface definition

  5. CLI Commands

    • parse command

    • status command

    • Basic error handling

Phase 2: Enhancement (1 week)

Additional features:

  1. Incremental Updates

    • Change detection using content hashes

    • Efficient update strategies

  2. Advanced Error Handling

    • Detailed error messages

    • Recovery mechanisms

    • Logging system

  3. Export Functionality

    • JSON export

    • CSV export

    • Custom formats

  4. Comprehensive Testing

    • Unit test coverage

    • Integration tests

    • Performance benchmarks

Phase 3: Future Extensions

Planned extensions:

  1. JupyterBook Support

    • JSON format parsing

    • Notebook integration

  2. Translation API Integration

    • OpenAI API

    • Claude API

    • Custom translation services

  3. Web UI

    • REST API backend

    • React frontend

    • Real-time updates

  4. Plugin System

    • Custom parser plugins

    • Translation service plugins

    • Export format plugins

Database Migrations

Creating Migrations

When schema changes are needed:

Migration Example
 1# migrations/001_add_review_status.py
 2def upgrade(db):
 3    db.execute("""
 4        ALTER TABLE translation_units 
 5        ADD COLUMN reviewer_id TEXT
 6    """)
 7    
 8def downgrade(db):
 9    # SQLite doesn't support DROP COLUMN
10    # Need to recreate table
11    pass

Running Migrations

Running Migrations
1docdiff db upgrade
2docdiff db downgrade --to 001

Performance Optimization

Indexing Strategy

Critical indexes for performance:

  • nodes.label - Reference resolution

  • nodes.parent_id - Hierarchy traversal

  • nodes.file_path - File operations

  • translation_units.status - Status filtering

Batch Operations

Process multiple files efficiently:

Batch Operations Example
1async def parse_batch(files: List[Path]) -> List[DocumentNode]:
2    tasks = [parse_file(f) for f in files]
3    results = await asyncio.gather(*tasks)
4    return flatten(results)

Caching

Implement caching for expensive operations:

Caching Example
1from functools import lru_cache
2
3@lru_cache(maxsize=128)
4def resolve_reference(label: str) -> Optional[str]:
5    # Expensive database lookup
6    return db.find_node_by_label(label)

Debugging Tips

Enable Debug Logging

Enable Debug Logging
1export DOCDIFF_LOG_LEVEL=DEBUG
2docdiff parse docs/

Database Inspection

Database Inspection
1# Open SQLite database
2sqlite3 .docdiff/structure.db
3
4# Useful queries
5.tables
6.schema nodes
7SELECT type, COUNT(*) FROM nodes GROUP BY type;

Parser Debugging

Parser Debugging
1# Enable AST printing
2from docdiff.parsers import MySTParser
3
4parser = MySTParser(debug=True)
5nodes = parser.parse(Path("test.md"))
6# Will print AST structure

Contributing Guidelines

Pull Request Process

  1. Create feature branch from main

  2. Write tests for new functionality

  3. Ensure all tests pass

  4. Update documentation

  5. Submit PR with clear description

Commit Message Format

Commit Message Format
feat: Add support for JupyterBook format

- Implement JSON parser
- Add notebook cell extraction
- Update CLI commands

Closes #123

Code Review Checklist

  • [ ] Type hints present

  • [ ] Tests written and passing

  • [ ] Documentation updated

  • [ ] No security vulnerabilities

  • [ ] Performance considered

  • [ ] Error handling complete
